author: Redway
title: Hospital Appointment
body:
I had an appointment at the Rheumatology Clinic at Lincoln County Hospital. When I got there I found the clinic had moved to clinic 1, I had not been previously told that the department had moved and was not provided with a map showing me where the new clinic was placed.  
On finding the clinic, I took a seat and waited for my appointment to proceed. When I got to see the consultant , he did not know anything about me and what medication I had been prescribed for my condition, he asked me all types of questions to ascertain how I was feeling and to what level this awful disease has taken me.  
I left the clinic feeling very unsure and dismayed. I will now have phone calls every six months instead of going 48 miles to the hospital. I told the consultant I had been prescribed HYDROXYCHLOROQUINE over the phone, had regular checks, and an eye test as prescribed.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Le Frisp
title: Nursery Court has brought my parents back to life
body:
As my parents entered their mid-to-late 80's , their mobility, cognition and general health deteriorated to such an extent they practically became prisoners in their own home. Their social circle slowly shrank to close family and carers. It became clear that these two formerly fit, active, outgoing people were slowly melting before our eyes.  
My mum secured a place at Nursery Court pre-pandemic, and we saw an immediate change in her. Overall, her demeanour and mood was lifted.  
Sadly the pandemic struck and she started to regress back into her shell.  
The pandemic and deteriorating health meant dad was suffering from lack of engagement as much as mum was.  
With a lot of help from South Ayrshire Social Services, a place was secured at Nursery Court for Dad, and both attend at the same time.  
I swear, if Dad could move into Nursery Court he would. He is literally chomping at the bit waiting for his transport to the day centre.  
I will make no apology for the gushing praise I am about to heap on Nursery Court. Every word of it has been hard earned.  
Nursery Court has brought my parents back to life, the social interaction with others in a similar position has literally re-lit their fire.  
The place would be nothing without the staff at the centre, attentive, caring and compassionate don't come close to describing their commitment to their clients.  
To be honest, clients is the wrong word to use, as it's obvious the staff treat my parents , and their other visitors, as a community, a family if you will. They somehow manage this while remaining uber-professional, which is a hard trick to pull off.  
I'm not equipped with sufficient superlatives to describe the worth this centre brings to the elderly of Lower South Ayrshire.  
The place has literally been a lifesaver for my parents and the world would be a better place if it had more facilities like Nursery Court.

readBy.name: South Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership

title: Fantastic
body:
I have been with Peel Croft Surgery for many years, I have never had a problem there, in fact you are always made to feel very comfortable and relaxed, even through changes of doctors through the years the practise has always 
maintained high standards and never faltered. Also whilst visiting through covid I found the appointment safe in every way with, it was a pleasant experience given the circumstances.

title: Great Surgery!
body: Always feel very well looked after by the team here and the process around Covid jabs has been managed brilliantly. Visited for 2nd Jab yesterday and the staff and volunteers were outstanding, all cheerful and friendly, despite being very busy

author: Jmommy
title: Person-centred and compassionate care
body:
Go team NHS Fife. I recently had to be taken by ambulance to VHK and spent an extended period of time in the Emergency Department.  
I want to praise ALL the staff from support - domestic and porters, clinical - nurses and doctors, and wider support including radiography and managers.  
We all know the system is creaking, but I can only commend the care I received and saw others receive. It was person-centered and compassionate, from the Dr who helped a patient with a personal need to the nurses who made sure the neediest had a bed not a trolley for their long wait.  
Despite all this I saw students across disciplines supported and given learning opportunities.  
What a team, and I want them to know I appreciated all they did under very trying circumstances. Keep going, you make a difference.

title: Friendly, great practice
body: Professional reception and doctors staff with knowledge and wonderful attitude. Very easy way to book an appointment. Doctor called me back within 15 minutes from booking and showed a lot understanding and compassion. They do care for they patients !!

author: Heaye79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Treated with respect
body:
I had a wonderful nurse who treated me with the utmost respect.  
She was kind and caring. I didn't feel embarrassed or awkward because she put me at ease.  
She also gave me some exercises to do to help prevent further issues, which are working well so far.  
Thank you

author: frosthw69
title: This is a convenient service
body:
I've really appreciated having this facility so close, as all my other treatments and appointments are in the Ulster Hospital. This is a convenient service, and so necessary to have in my locality.  
It means I can travel easily to appointments, saving on fuel and parking costs as well.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Experience
body: I attended the surgical assessment clinic on Monday with a big and very painful groin abscess. The staff were polite, very caring and made me comfortable. Due to the size of the abscess I was put o to antibiotics and asked to return for a review today. Once again I was seen promptly by the surgical assessment team who were sensitive to the pain I was in and made me very comfortable until I was taken for surgery. The porter, anesthetic team and the staff in the recovery room were all fantastic, they had a laugh with me and put me at ease - the latter were superb at getting my pain under control. In now on a ward recovering with sof lovely staff and hope to go home tomorrow. Thanks to everyone that's been involved in my care since Monday, you are simply fantastic and I cannot thank you enough!

title: Such lovely staff
body: Just had a recent visit to Amersham Dermatology, slightly apprehensive about having a small mole removed from my back. I was taken into some newly refurbished rooms. The 2 Staff that carried out the procedure were incredible, being caring and knowledgeable. Within minutes I knew I was in expert hands. Thank you and all your colleagues

title: Definitely improving
body:
I have been a member of this practice for a number of years now , I have previously had negative experiences there , recently I have notified a huge improvement in the service being provided this is really encouraging 
Thanks

title: Vaccinations
body: I've  had all my Vaccinations at Hornsey Health Centre and I was a bit nervous each time I went, the Staff were  good and professional and reassuring, Well done! I'm booked for my fourth autumn booster later this month and once again I'm worried as I had reaction to my last one Pfizer booster, so hoping things will be better this time.

title: Great receptionist
body:
I would like to say a massive thank you to the lovely receptionist who assisted me with my daughters appointments today.
She was so helpful and welcoming and went above and beyond.
Thank you so much.

title: Amazing practice
body: I cannot thank the sherwood rise medical centre enough for going above and beyond for me recently - in particular the reception team and the secretary. I can’t fault their outstanding service and how they have dealt with me as a patient. Would highly recommend to my friends and family as a great practice.

author: aurigard49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Gastroscopy, bad experience
body:
I have had a Gastroscopy recently and I felt it was not a good service.  
I was sedated for the procedure and the procedure was not done until 11’oclock. However, 20 minutes after the procedure, a nurse came to collect me and she tried to get me on my feet immediately. I was not stable and nearly fell over that time.  
The same nurse came back after half past 12 to discharge me, however I was still very wobbly and I feel I was made up to stand up before I was ready.  
My friend was very concerned for me when I was discharged.  
I feel that I was not given enough time to recover on the trolly after the procedure. I think it would be better to give more time for people to get ready, especially after sedation to ensure that the patient is awake and steady enough on their feet.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body:
The reception staff, nurses and doctors at this surgery cannot be faulted.

Unfortunately having needed their services for my children above average I have been extremely grateful .

author: patpost
title: Getting paid work
body:
Due to some health and mental health issues, I hadn’t worked for some time. The doctor that I see at the NHS Trust referred me to the Future’s Positive IPS Employment Support service and my Employment Specialist in turn arranged a meeting with a lady from the New Start employment scheme.  
I accepted a paid thirteen week placement in a small, independent local business. This placement has provided me with a routine and a more ‘structured’ day. As well as extra money, which is a bonus.  
This work placement has helped immeasurably with my general and mental health, and has given me back some confidence. I see it as the way forward to more paid work opportunities.  
Thank you to the IPS Team and others at 65 Northgate and to the people at the New Start scheme.

title: Consistently High Service
body:
The issue with writing a review, in my opinion, is that it can be very subjective, an opportunity to let off steam and not be very balanced. I’m writing my review after forty years of experience with this practice and hope that what follows is reflective and fair.
My wife and I have consistently received a high quality service from this practice. We have seen many GPs and other staff come and go but still maintain excellence and respond seamlessly to new initiatives over time.
GPs we have seen have always been thorough, totally professional and reassuring, always signposting where necessary. All other staff have been friendly, pleasant, taking extra time to put us at our ease, leading to positive outcomes. Staff are clearly led by an efficient, innovative Practice Manager. An example of this has been the recent COVID-19 vaccination programme - superbly organised and executed. We have always found reception staff to be very pleasant too. They have a difficult job. It is reasonable to ask the reason for an appointment. Given the high demand for appointments, there has to a filtering system. However, when the issue has been personal or private, we have said so and this has been respected by reception staff and we have been given an appointment.
Online services for ordering repeat prescriptions, accessing test results and booking appointments are first class and are the envy of many of our friends and family. Booking appointments on the day are also available provided you telephone the surgery as soon as it opens.
Thank you PHMG for the excellent service you provide and have provided over many, many years.

title: Efficient and friendly
body: I don’t go often to the doctors but when I do this practice has been amazing. I’ve been with them for 15 years and they’ve never let me down. They have some really amazing doctors one of which I recently saw who sent me for tests and was very reassuring and above all else was just so kind and lovely and the nurse I saw recently for my smear deserves to have a Damehood for her caring professional expertise. No complaints from me and there hasn’t been for 15 years.

author: smithd02
title: Very good treatment
body: Very good treatment from Sarah and team. Also excellent treatment from theatre staff Karen, Clarinda and Sara.

title: Great practice
body:
I have been a patient here for a number of years and have found this to be a great surgery to access care from. 
I took my son to the surgery yesterday having called the day before to book an appointment. The reception staff were helpful and kind and booked a telephone appointment for the next day.
I spoke to one of the partners the next day. She took time to listen and understand concerns, her manner was kind and she explained next steps really clearly.  
We were seen the same morning by a junior doctor who was really lovely with my 3 y/o. My son felt nervous about coming to the surgery and the doctor we saw took time to make him feel at ease. She was really kind to him and engaged with him really nicely. Again, she listened really carefully and clearly explained the next steps- I felt really confident in the care we were receiving. 
Overall, I felt that the care we received was really patient centred and individualised. I didn’t feel like we were being rushed or wasting anyone’s  time. All the staff we encountered were kind and patient. 
Thank you

title: Superb Department
body:
Yesterday as a fairly anxious patient I attended the Endoscopy Department at The Evesham Community Hospital.
From being met at the entrance door to being discharged I found all the staff I encountered brim full of compassion and politeness.
I shouldn't single out staff however I must mention the two nurses and the endoscopist who attended at my procedure. They couldn't have been more attentive and caring. I was as relaxed as I could be during the procedure.  They kept me informed throughout the short examination. 
Any would be person facing an endoscopy in this department can be rest assured that you are in the best hands.
Thank you all staff.

title: Ridiculous call hold times
body: Was told to call by my own ortho, when I do call I’m always on hold for more than an hour. Unacceptable amount of time to wait just for a 5 min or less chat, never mind a call my own orthodontist told me to make.

title: Great practice
body:
As a new patient the experience I've had with this practice so far has been very positive, the staff are polite and caring.
The receptionists even answer the phone which is totally different to my previous practice.
Keep up the excellent work

title: Wonderful GP practice
body: In a world where GP practices seem to be under constant criticism  Abbey is an example of how despite all the difficulties (or should I say challenges!) they are doing an excellent job.  The staff are always polite, helpful and kind and although the system isn't perfect they are always striving to improve. Many thanks to all the staff.

author: Mhairi32
title: Attending the ReACH clinic
body:
From the moment that I met Jean I was well impressed. I knew that without a doubt I was being listened to and that Jean was engaging with me in a way that you don’t find very often.  
Throughout the months that I have attended her clinic I have been extremely impressed by her kindness, her knowledge and her caring way of treating my problem. Throughout my treatment, we have had a few laughs and she has listened to my stories.  
This has helped me to relax and feel positive about my treatment. I have been discharged today, and I leave feeling positive about the future. Thank you, Jean.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: treetelford
title: Sexual health clinic visit
body:
Sexual health review and commenced PREP and monkey pox vaccine.  
Felt very informed and supported throughout !  
Very caring doctor who took time to explain things !

title: Compassionate & Caring!
body:
I wanted to leave a review to testify that I have been with the practice now for a full 12 months!
Reception staff are always polite and helpful, as are the GP's and other clinical staff in the practice.
It's the best practice I have ever been with.
You are all appreciated very much....Thank You :)

title: The practice is 5 star in my books
body: I cannot thank the practice and especially our usual gp yesterday Thursday, November for the fantastic treatment and advice given when diagnosed with covid and being immunosuppressed. After a lengthy talk with my gp she said t’s probably nothing serious but her concerns were that my airways were constricting and if it hadn’t got better in about an hour then to call 999. We left it a couple of hours and decided to call 999 where the call Center stayed on line till the rapid response vehicle arrived about 6 minutes after making the call. Initially the gp had referred me on Sunday for antiviral treatment as I’m immunosuppressed and was entitled to have the antivirals for covid. The practice is renowed throughout the area as being one of the best. All the staff from reception to doctors to ancillary services and are great and always with a welcoming smile. Sure they have  been inundated during the pandemic but now have an even larger team of doctors in place and is also a renowned teaching practice. In fact 18 years ago the gp at the time got things moving for tests and I was diagnosed with leukaemia with in 2 days. Thank you Schopwick

title: Well done
body: My walk in COVID vaccination went really well thanks to all the staff and the way it was set up. Full marks.

title: Will be coming back to have my next baby here
body:
I had my son in autumn 2020 and was really impressed by the care I received having my baby. I’ll never forget the kind treatment of the midwives.
The doctors checked in where necessary and i felt save in their hands and hearing their advice when things weren’t going smoothly.
Overal a really good experience.

title: Positive experience
body: I had a troublesome but not major medical issue which I was anxious to get resolved. I got an I initial appointment with the practice paramedic/nurse the morning I called. Later in the day an ear invention was diagnosed and I got a GP callback and prescription sent to my pharmacy. Excellent response throughout, including the helpful telephone receptionist. Thank you.

title: Committed and efficient service
body: The last two interactions with the Hollies have been really  good experiences. I always say thank you when I leave, but wanted to formally say that I am so so grateful for the compassionate, friendly and helpful service- from the reception to the people signposting the way in and out during my jab appointments to the medical staff and the pharmacy. With the amount of pressure faced by the NHS, I want to shout from the rooftops about the personal dedication and commitment we see everyday at the Hollies. Thank you

title: Great Practice
body: As always, excellent medical centre, kind, organised, fast to act, good follow up. We are lucky here in Nether Edge to have Hollies.

title: Thank you so much!
body: Thank you to all of the team who were involved in triaging me on Friday from the Reception staff to the doctor. Thank you so much for agreeing to see me that day and then referring me to the QE. My eye had a corneal ulcer which was infected and I dread to think what would have happened if you hadn't helped me so well.

author: cubedq95
title: Poor experience in the Assessment unit
body:
We arrived as requested at 8:30, no one here to greet us.  
My father has come from the ND hospice today. I had a letter to give staff but they said they didn't need it. The staff did not really engage, very task orientated.  
We saw a doctor who spoke to us in a room full of other patients, no privacy. No chance to ask questions. Very rushed . No one has checked on my dad, luckily I have pain medication with us to give him.  
The doctor did come back promptly with a proposed plan for procedures this week. None of the other patients were checked for comfort levels.  
I have asked if we can now go and staff have asked us to wait. We are now waiting again. Dad is sat on a chair and keen to get back to the care and comfort of the ND Hospice

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: AlanB74
title: Friendly and Efficient
body:
My GP recommended a 24 hr BP monitor with advice to ring West Bridgford Health Centre .

As I was visiting for my wife’s appointment , I asked at reception for an appointment ideally same day as I was going on holiday for 10 days. 

Not only did reception fit me in , my wait was 5 minutes to have the monitor fitted which I duly returned next day .

So refreshing to receive a warm welcome , but also a professional service from nursing and receptionist staff at West Bridgford Health Centre.

Thanks

author: Corridorxg
title: Beds in corridors
body:
My mother suffers from a degenerative brain condition and currently lives in a residential care home and is completely reliant on others for all aspects of her care. She is cognitively sound but physically she is wheelchair bound, uses machinery to transfer, cannot wash or feed herself and is unable to speak or communicate verbally. She uses pointing and a spell board to point at phrases and commands.  
She was scheduled for PEG feeding tube insertion due to her being unable to get enough nutrition orally. We were asked to arrive at 14:00 the day before her procedure at Ward 104. My mother was extremely nervous about going into hospital as people who do not know her find it very difficult to understand her way of communicating and she was worried about her procedure.  
When we arrived, we were informed that there was no bed for her and directed to the relatives room. We were given no timescale for a bed being ready and waited for 6 hours (with my mother becoming agitated and upset. She was sore from sitting in her wheelchair for 6 hours) before a doctor informed us that they would put her in a bed in the corridor for the night as they couldn't free up a room.  
My mother was completely against this suggestion, as was I. My mother was expected to lie in a corridor with no privacy or dignity. She would have been hoisted for going to the toilet etc in her nightwear in the middle of a busy corridor, would have had no rest in the bright lights and was already incredibly nervous about her admission. Most importantly in this situation, she would have no access to a call button which would have meant that she would have been unable to summon assistance if she was in pain, needed help to move or needed the toilet as she cannot shout out or help herself.  
Fortunately, I was there to speak up and refuse this. If I wasn't there, she wouldn't have been able to communicate her feelings about the situation and they would have put her in the corridor despite it being wholly inappropriate. It was only when I said that I would just take her back to her care home rather than sleep in the corridor that they were all of a sudden able to move a patient to another ward to free up a proper bed space.  
I write this not to complain about waiting for 6 hours (without her being offered a drink, we bought water for her cup) but to complain that it was suggested to leave her for the night in a corridor with no regard to her needs or abilities and no foresight of the risk and distress that that could have caused her.  
I sincerely hope that leaving people in corridors without access to call buttons, without direct supervision, without dignity or comfort is not common practice. I'm just glad I was there to advocate for her.  
I would like to mention that the nursing staff were sympathetic and did agree that it was not appropriate or acceptable but they are being put in this situation due to current pressures. Pressures or not, the patients (and nursing staff) should not have to be put at risk.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: hadares54
title: Losing Confidence in Dr Surgery
body:
My last two (one for me, one for my child) e-consults have gone past the time they said they would get back to me, the last one I had to chase them for it. I have been on high dosage of anti depressants for the past 7 years but have not had a mental health check up in over 5 years, they just keep prescribing me the same amount every month.  
Am also on tablets for intercranal hypertension, was discharged from the eye clinic, in their letter they wanted my daily dosage reduced, this was 2 years ago, if not more, still haven’t been seen by my GP regarding this or even had a check up to see if I have any swelling behind my eyes or anything.  
I am really starting to lose confidence in this doctors surgery and really don’t feel that they are there for the patients. Whenever I try to make an appointment I get told to do an e-consult and then they don’t get back to me until after the time.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: nuthatchpf37
title: Unscheduled check up
body: I needed some reassurance that a change of medication was not causing other issues.

author: Abisz74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: poor communication
body:
I was seen by the Urgent Community Response Team Mid Hampshire whilst I was unwell at home. One occasion during my care left me miffed, to put it mildly.  
I was upset because an ambulance was called when I had asked for them not to be called. I did agree to this after a while with the nurse that visited me, but I didn't want to go to hospital. I didn't go to hospital.The next morning when another staff member came to see me I was told that the team member from the previous day that had called the ambulance was absolutely furious that I wasn't in hospital. I was told that I was bleeding internally and I wasn't. The rash on my stomach has been seen by doctors in the hospice and it is not new and then they said that if the oedema in my midriff went passed my midriff I would die. I did not like the way they said it. If I was a shrinking violet I think I would have been terrified.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: Covid jab
body: Congrats to all the ladies on there super efficiency today!! Perhaps they can give our govt. a few lessons!!

author: Coolgirl27722
title: Birth control Implant change
body: Today I had my implant replaced. I was really nervous and worried because I had heard so many horror stories of young woman having them ripped out and struggled to get them out because of scar tissue but mine was so easy. Sara did an amazing job she really helped explain it to me and I didn’t feel a thing. It was such an easy thing to do and I feel so much better.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: ruiceI02
title: Raigmore Hospital, Maternity Unit
body:
I would like to give a big thank you for the Raigmore Hospital Maternity Unit for all the assistance and support during the time of my labour and postpartum.  
I was sent to induction in Raigmore Hospital, and I had been taken to a room by a student midwife and one other (do not recall their name, apologies!!). The student midwife had performed a membrane sweep and everything had went smoothly, after a couple of hours I had began having contractions, and in the next few hours I had given birth to my baby boy.  
In the labour room there were two other midwifes and the student midwife, they'd been professional, supportive, kind and overall gave me the support and assistance that I required (still do not recall their names).  
After labour I had been in the hospital for 3 more days, all of the midwives, doctors, etc had been very helpful and provided me everything I had needed.  
I just want to say a big thank you from me and baby boy to them for all the support those few days.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Excellent treatment
body: I would like to say how grateful I am for the treatment received from the Pain Management team. The paperwork received prior to my appointment was clear and concise. All staff from my greeting at reception to my release following a morning procedure were courteous, professional and caring. After suffering nagging back pain for years I am delighted with the relief given following radio frequency ablation. I was kept informed of every detail of the procedure throughout and I am so pleased with the results. I cannot thank you enough and I would recommend your department to anyone suffering similar issues.

title: Hardworking and caring practice
body: I am very impressed by the efficiency of the practice. It is normal that we have to wait awhile to be answered on the telephone. The reception team always do their best and are kind and helpful. I have always been able to speak to a doctor via telephone or get an appointment when really needed. Thank you for all your help.

title: Very happy with the service
body:
I have big anxiety from dentists since my private dentist gave me a awful last experience . I was afraid to go back there and wasnt able to change my dentist as the local ones didnt take new patients .

Anyways , about two months ago had severe pain , swelling and locked jaw due to my wisdom tooth . Was at work and had to leave early , called every dentist for emergency appoitment .

Ended up getting an appoitment at the dental hospital through 111 in which I was seen the next day . They examined and concluded that there was a infection forming because my tooth was impacted and had no space to push through . Gave me antibiotics and explained how to care for it . Luckily after being seen the infection was gone but was suggested for a removal .

I was severely scared about it but staff were super comforting and explained everything through the extraction . Made sure to check up on me as I was shaking . Provided after care information , no medication but in all honesty only needed paracetamol on the first day .

Area is healing well no pain or any issues . Super happy with the service and staff . I feel a little more comfortable as the service was so smooth .

title: Disgusting
body: Today I went to the walk-in centre for an clear infection on my tonsils and I was there for 2hours, after the 2hours I got told there wasn’t anything they could give me, after them saying that it’s a viral infection and that it’s clearly bright red and swollen and starting to cover my air ways, my experience was disgusting, they could see I was in obvious pain with this too.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: falconvn18
title: Lack of clinical examination
body:
I attended BGH, A&E department after an accident.  
I was seen by a doctor who was extremely preoccupied throughout my consultation. When explaining the accident, I felt like everything I said went straight over the top of their head. My concerns were not listened to and I spent less than 5 minutes with this doctor.  
I made the doctor aware that I hit my head during the accident and wasn’t even given a neurological examination to check for concussion or any other head injury.  
I wasn’t asked if I had taken any medication or pain relief following the accident, nor was any advice given to me on what medication to take following the accident.  
The doctor treated my consultation like a therapy session. They continually complained about lack of staff (due to sickness and people leaving) and how nothing was restocked because of this.  
I am aware the NHS is on its knees and I sympathise with all the stress and pressure all NHS staff are facing, but the distinct lack of care is not on. Mistakes are going to be made and lives potentially lost.  
I have never attended A&E before, and this experience has completely put me off going ever again. If I do ever need to attend A&E again, I hope I see a doctor who actually listens to my concerns and I hope it’s one that gives me a full clinical examination.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Good practice
body: The practice is getting better and to get to speak to GP is improving. The staffs are all professional and always ready to help

title: Excellent practice
body: I unfortunately experienced an unexpected mental health breakdown from July this year. I have received absolutely amazing care from Park Road medical practice. I have never had an issue like this before and a few times rang upset, every receptionist I spoke to was lovely and caring. The GPs and Nurse Practitioner were extremely supportive and helpful as were the mental health team. I have felt very lucky to have had such good help from park road practice during this time and are very grateful for their time and patience.

title: Fantastic Service
body:
Having recently joined with this practice, I have to say the team here have made me feel extremely welcome; I have received invitations for reviews, vaccinations and have had to receive care on a health issue, which was dealt with quickly and in a sympathetic fashion. I am very pleased to have chosen such an efficient and friendly surgery. 
The use of Ask My GP makes the whole appointment process simple and efficient - thank you for your dedication to everyone who works at the practice!

title: Above and beyond great service
body:
Today my son was v poorly. Phoned practice they phoned back within 5 mins and he was seen within 30 mins
Fantastic. Thankyou so much.

author: Sinéad
title: Excellent and professional service.
body: I was referred for an emergency ultrasound and TA scan. I got an appointment really quickly. When I came for my appointment the staff couldn’t have been nicer. They did everything they could to keep me informed and make sure I felt comfortable. Excellent and professional service.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: laura87
title: Breast cancer 🎀
body:
First-class service by NHS Scotland  
In January 2021, I was diagnosed with stage 3 breast cancer in my thirties. It was the most difficult year of my life with nine months of an unpredictable and gruelling treatment plan. I can not fault the care and expertise from my oncologists, surgeons and dedicated nurses. Without them I would not be here. Forever grateful to the NHS.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Tattoo girl
title: Tattoo nipple after double reconstruction
body:
I was fed up after surgery all over the place after my double/reconstruction. I was told about tattoo nipple procedure. I thought, Why bother? I don't look at them anyways, or even show anyone my breast after being done.  
I saw some nipple tattoo pictures, and after a very long while I decided, yes, lets do this. Maybe this is the missing part of me feeling comfortable in myself.  
Wow wow wow, I got new nipples tattooed 😍  
The reaction I certainly wasn't expecting because I was so negative about this procedure, thinking another procedure, but am honestly so so happy with the outcome I said to what surprised me.  
I really can't wait to now look at myself in the mirror and be proud of my new breast, well my newly tattoo nipples, also it's made me see the reconstruction also in such a different mindset, it really was the missing piece 💖  
I hope my story can help anyone that's struggling as this point and maybe help ease their thinking towards this procedure.  
New nipple day made me feel like me again, and I thank that lovely lady also for her care and perfect colouring time taken to make me feel me.

title: Friendly and helpful staff
body: Reception and clinical staff very friendly and helpful. Appointments ran on time and good system in place to manage throughout of clinic

title: Nice place great people excellent servulice and…
body: It is a great shame that the NHS applications make it so difficult to be an equally good patient..... A questionnaire that will not allow one to set the year of birth?

author: Heartfelt John
title: An angiogram
body:
When you are told you may have a heart condition and need to have an angiogram, thoughts can tend to go straight to quadruple by-pass etc.  
When Nurse Ficker in East Surrey Hospital’s rapid chest pain clinic suggested this, it could not have been done in a nicer way, so kind and caring and full of detail. It was the intervening couple of weeks that were the worst; had I known however how good the whole process was going to be at the Angiogram suite in East Surrey Hospital, then most of my worries would have been eased. Right from the moment I stepped into the suite, I was looked after by a team of wonderful doctors, nurses, assistants, cleaners and tea ladies. Every stage was clearly explained, I was lead through the whole process and really couldn’t have asked for more - apart from not having to be there in the first place perhaps.  
My outcome was positive - just keep taking the tablets - but I suspect that if further action was required, I would have been cared for in the same, professional, caring manner. Thank you to Dr Iqbal and the very kind lady doctor in the red scrubs - (I’m sorry your name came first and my mind was buzzing) - Mency, Winston, Jeanie, Catia and Daniel who managed to find my hidden veins when so many hospitals have failed in the past, plus all the others in the suite who shaved bits, stuck on bits etc. and the lovely cleaner with dark hair who sang quietly whilst she cleaned the bathroom and chatted and the lady who bought in that first beautiful cup of tea. It’s these things that make a hospital special. Thank you.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Okay practice
body: Overall the practice is okay but I do feel like sometimes I have to diagnose myself to be taken seriously. I also felt like I had to prompt for basic information about my ailment

author: raymonds02
title: My recent stay at Grantham Hospital EAU
body:
I was admitted to the Emergency Assessment Unit at Grantham Hospital. I had a CT scan followed by a lumbar puncture. I then had a second CT scan. I was informed by a junior doctor on the ward that I was at risk of an aneurysm due to a pinched cerebral artery and may need a stent fitting to resolve the problem.  
This came as a big shock and caused considerable stress to me and my family due to the perceived risk and uncertainty of both the procedure and aftermath. I was then told by my registrar consultant that I had been misinformed the evening before and the explanation given was inaccurate. He then explained that I would need a final MRI scan to make 100% sure everything was in order.  
This was carried out, and I was given a clean bill of health and discharged from hospital. I was very upset with being given inaccurate information by the junior doctor and the stress that it caused me overnight. I didn’t expect this to happen and feel that there was a poor level of advice albeit this was corrected the following morning.  
Overall I was pleased with the level of care I was given, although this was tainted somewhat by the situation described above. Thank you.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: giraffekx47
title: Excellent advice and support
body: Visit today from Jill, Oldmeldrum Health Visitor. Excellent advice and support, made both myself and little one feel at ease. No question is a silly question to Jill and she always leaves making you feel like you are doing something right! It’s lovely to have such a wealth of knowledge and experience just a message away.

title: Let down
body: I have been waiting for an appointment since July, finally offered an appointment which was then cancelled the day before by text. Called surgery to rearrange and told I need to wait for the booking team to call me, promised call that day. Two days later, no call and still no appointment. The Dr I saw in July said to avoid stress!!

title: Great care received
body: I had 2 wisdom teeth out at this hospital. The staff were all so kind and caring and very efficient. The surgeon was friendly and made me laugh during my surgery appointment which put me totally at ease. Would recommend this hospital to everyone.

author: VelmaDi
title: I was treated with dignity
body:
Wanted to say a huge thank you to the staff who kept me calm, comfortable and informed during a colonoscopy.  
A nurse named Karen was superb and gave me information which helped me know what to expect and really made a huge difference to my visit. Having a simple explanation of an unknown helped me deal with what was happening. She kept talking and making sure I was ok, which is part of the job, but I wanted to commend her for doing it brilliantly.  
I was able to not use sedation, minimal entonox and remain calm as she managed to lower my anxiety of the unknown and by this, got it over and done with quickly feeling minimal side effects from the procedure.  
I was treated with dignity, cared for by umpteen staff and was very proud of NHS Grampian.  
Thank you very much. It’s the simple things that matter the most sometimes!

title: 7 hours no call back-age 88
body: 7 hours so far waiting on a call back for my 88 year old nan who is on a cold floor, in pain and unable to move. Classed as non emergancy...told it could be at least another 6 hours to wait. Been told because the belief is nothing is broken she has to wait. Its now almost midnight, she lives alone. Discussed that this is how we treat people who are in serious need.

title: Excellent mammogram
body: I have always experienced problems having a mammogram, lots of discomfort and complications with procedure, but today was so painless and straightforward.  The member of staff dealt with everything so expertly, the experience was totally different from previous checks. Thank you so much.

author: Oct13
title: Mesh Removal Operation
body:
I had an extremely good team of people caring for me last week when in hospital at the QEUH, Glasgow, undergoing vaginal mesh removal.  
All staff, be it cleaners, auxiliaries, nurses, doctors, anaethestists, physios and surgeons were all professional, helpful, friendly people whose care was second to none. However the care started long before my operation:the consultation team at the New Victoria Hospital, Glasgow; services since the initial consultation, including physiotherapy; preoperation nurses & doctors, and since my release from hospital, and after only four days I have a number of follow-up appointments in place.  
Nothing was a problem to the very busy staff and in fact on numerous occasions I was told to buzz if I required anything further.  
The only criticism I have is about breakfast - there was no fruit or juice offered. All other meals had a good choice, served hot & well and drinks too.  
These groups of NHS staff are dedicated professionals.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: cepheushp77
title: Quality and helpful team
body:
I had a colonoscopy and was slightly apprehensive on the procedure. Couldn't believe the politeness, kindness and sheer professional way of all the staff I had on the day of the procedure. I had 3 checks of my Name, Dob, meds etc etc and was reassured by Specialist Leigh of what to expect and what they wanted to achieve. I couldn't believe this service and was so grateful.  
The nurses were all top drawer and so good I can remember all their names: both Elaine's , Brenda, T, Kelly Ann, Donna and Dawn ....and of course the best Specialist, colon inspector Leigh ...from my heart....Thank you all to the best department xxxxxxx

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Lovely nurses
body: I was sent from my gp who thought I had a blood clot in my leg. I arrived at ambulatory care unit and was welcomed by two lovely nurses. Everything was explained to me as I wasn’t sure why I had been sent there and I was out within less than two hours. The nurse who seen me was very polite and looked after  me throughout my visit as I get very restless in hospitals. She let me know what was happening while I was there waiting for blood test results and I am due back for a scan of my leg today. I could see she was very busy with other people who was there for the same reason. The other nurse kept me comfortable with tea and biscuits. Great service.

title: Blue badge parking...dismal!
body:
Wrightington is a centre of excellence for orthopaedics. With this in mind I would like to say how awful parking is for disabled people. 
There are simply not enough spaces available near the therapy dept. I need to fully open my car door to get in and out, I use two crutches. Parking in the top car park is simply not an option. 
It really stresses me out, I worry more about getting a disabled parking space than the actual treatment, thats simply not right.
My friend who uses a rollator has actually missed two appointments now as she couldnt get a space.
Its awful, its stressful. Please do something about it...I attend hospital twice a week and its stressing me out!!!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

author: MakeChange
title: Lack of person centred care
body:
I was absolutely disgusted to find that my palliative relative felt they were like a lump of dough whilst being cared for in the QEUH in one of their general medical wards.  
Firstly, please stop washing people from 05:00-07:00 in the morning unless there is a clinical need and even less so don’t bother washing patients if you’re going to just dampen them and roughly move them within the bed. Stop prioritising washes before the dayshift come in - especially when washes are not done properly or with the persons wants and wishes in mind.  
Secondly, and this cannot be attributed to short staffing- but we found the attitude, language and tone used especially by healthcare support workers is shocking. How can you accuse an elderly person of not being unwell enough or that they should have known better because they’ve been incontinent?! I cannot imagine why staff would speak to others in this way never mind patients.  
Additionally- don’t forget that feeding those in hospital is incredibly important for their health journey but also as a human need. Cold, inedible food cannot be acceptable- surely there needs to be a minimum temperature of food served.  
Please encourage staff to be considerate and compassionate, if all the washes are not done it’s okay- it’s 24/7 care and some people - myself included- would be outraged to be woken at 06:00 for a barely basin wash, rushed and felt to be like a lump of dough.  
Please reinforce how powerful language is when speaking to patients and how this greatly impacts the patient and human experience.  
I greatly understand staffing pressure and the difficulties each staff member of every band face but this cannot excuse the care delivery given especially to those who are most vulnerable.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Very poor
body: For 2 days I've  been trying  to get an appointment to see the   nurse  regarding  a problem  with  my  left  ear ra g doctors  at 0820 this morning  in position 16 finally  got through  at 08.45 only  to be told  they've  reached  there  capacity so couldn't see nurse  or doctor  once  again  very frustrating  I have found  this practice unsatisfactory  towards  elderly  patients

title: Overwhelmed
body:
I've been with this GP since birth. Pre-covid I had no shortage of good things to say and had recommended them several times to people. Now, however is a different story.

For some reason the ability to book appointments online was taken away, leading to being told to queue up outside in all weathers before the surgery opens at 8am for an appointment. I'm physically impaired and this is honestly a fairly impossible ask, as the appointments are not for any close time and therefore I'd be expected to leave and return when operating with very limited mobility. Good luck on trying to phone up as the alternative though, you'll be hung up on or the line will be busy for well over an hour, possibly in the hopes you'll give up as you know there'll be nothing left. Don't be so silly as to try and book appointments with the GP in advance, either, though. They don't do that.

The entire roster of doctors seems to have more or less completely changed multiple times over the last two years. It's frustrating to always have to explain one's medical history anew at every appointment.

Honestly I can't say I plan to stay here. If you've a job or anything prohibiting you from queuing indefinitely outside for a maybe-appointment, this is not the place for you. They can't cope with the increasing local demand and it shows.

author: Paultaxi999
title: If you need help, don’t think twice
body:
I woke up early one morning not feeling very well with a racing heart. My wife took me to A&E, where they admitted me for 10 days. I was found to have a condition called SCAD, which is very very rare in men.They sometimes heal, but mine didn’t so the thought of the unknown took me over the edge. My anxiety got worse and worse because of my condition. I was not allowed to lift anything or exercise. I started to feel useless and that I was of no use to my family. I began to get thoughts of they would be better if I wasn’t here.  
That's when I turned to my GP for help and medication, but he said I can’t have any. I was now at my wit's end, and found out about Inclusion from the call in that morning. I immediately felt as if I had some help. First I did an online panic course which at first seems like, How’s that going to work?  
Well, 6 weeks of online sessions and the difference was amazing. I was able to get back to 90% of a normal life. They then gave me a worry by course of 6 weeks and at first you think, Hows this going to help? But as a 61-year-old who’s had anxiety my whole life, it works. It is such a simple technique, but it works lol.  
You have to keep at it every day, 20 mins allocated, but as I have said it works. You don’t cure anxiety, but you ignore it, live with it. I am back to work, awaiting heart operations, and yes I have moments when I’m anxious, it’s normal to worry about having a heart procedure, but I’m able to let anxiety run its course and cope after all. Anxiety has never killed anyone.  
Finally, I would like to thank all the staff at Inclusion. They are a welcoming, nonjudgmental, helpful group of professionals. If you need help, don’t think twice about inclusion :)

title: Very good experience of having a shingles jab and…
body: Kind and efficient consultations on having shingles and flu jab on two separate occasions. Many reminders of the jabs may have been a little over done but must obviously be necessary to stop people not turning up.

author: marseh89
title: Covid vaccine
body: Well organised, helpful, friendly and quick.

author: ellie0511
title: Honesty and transparency
body:
I was really struggling and feeling really hopeless about life as I had a lot of feelings and I wasn’t really sure what it was. I felt really different and as if no one really understood me.  
After attending CAMHS I was diagnosed with Autism and everything really made sense after that. At CAMHS it felt like all of my workers understood me really well and I felt very at ease knowing that I wasn’t crazy or horrible- my brain just works different to other people.  
I found that working with Laura helped me a lot as I was able to understand myself more. I worked on Safety and Stabilisation with her. I found that in appointments I was able to talk about my thoughts and feelings freely and without judgement. I also struggled really badly with feeling low but since working with Laura I’ve found a massive improvement in my overall mood and attitude to life. I really appreciated her honesty and transparency throughout our sessions and I found my appointments were always something I was looking forward to rather than dreading which was new for me. She has really helped me :)

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Feel let down
body: Had a spinal injection several years ago and this practice was brilliant at organising this at Salford Royal. I called in yesterday to try and book an appointment explaining to the receptionist I have tried on the phone at 8 am for over 2 weeks as the pain is now quite severe without success I also explained my hearing loss is a lot worse so I can’t always understand on the telephone. She told me to use the nhs app which I have just done at 8am and 3 telephone triage came up and on each one when I clicked on went to not available. I really don’t know what to do next as although I can hardly walk with the pain A&E are to busy with accidents etc, although I am a OAP I still go to the Gym and I run for a local athletic club so I very rarely bother Peterloo medical centre with ailments, the Doctors and Nurses are probably very good I just don’t know. So sad what has happened to this practice.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Fantastic Nurse Team
body: Nervous patient regarding blood test. Nurse was fantastic, friendly, patient and understanding. Ardleigh surgery is very lucky to have such a lovely team of nurses, thank you.

author: Ward3MDT
title: My time in Ward 3
body: Well cared for day and night by all the Ward 3 staff. Enjoyed being asked how I was first thing in the morning. When I arrived my left knee was very stiff but with rehab my knee has got more movement and I am able walk short distances. Enjoyed the activity morning every Thursdays run by the team. I felt it lifted my heart as it made everyone smile and it was wonderful to see other patients and staff take part.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Missing information
body: I am looking for directions to the fracture clinic and can find no reference to it in the departments list or on the map of the hospital.  My father-in-law is 89 years old and with very limited mobility so clarification of where he is to attend is vital.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Blood test results
body:
I rang the surgery to ask about the results of some blood tests;  I was told that the result was "no further action required".  However, I wanted to see the results for myself so I asked if I could pick up a printed copy.  The receptionist said it was not possible as the policy of the doctors was that it had to be done through the Internet.
  This is not the requirement of other surgeries, for example, Wallingford medical practice.  My partner is a patient there;  he only has to ask for a printout of test results and they oblige without hesitation.
  Please can we have the same service at Goring and \woodcote surgery.  I am sure that they are just as busy at Wallingford.

title: Useless
body: I had waiting 9 hours to be seen by doctor,i had lots pain,sitting on chair other senario,i want to ask all staff of the Nhs even manager veo doctor,would u seat those chairs 3 4 hours than u will 8 dersta d,we like to support u ,we like to respect you but you have to show same things against us,

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Delays not good enough
body: I am an older patient. It took 18 months for my GP to make a referral after being asked to by the hospital that treats me. I chased with the surgery and was refused a face to face appointment as the reception said they don't do them anymore. I wasn't listened to in the telephone appointments. It's not good enough.

author: Cat67
title: Excellent consultant care
body: For 16 years my son has been under the care of a few consultants at Belfast Children's Hospital. I cannot thank them enough for the support and treatment they all provide. Especially Dr. Mano, Neurosurgeon and Respiratory Clinic as without their ongoing support we would have been feeling very lost in how to treat our child.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Practice, helpful, efficient and friendly
body: Immediate response to any questions I had, and with a smile. Felt like they genuinely cared. As an old person I felt I had at last found a surgery that I had confidence in.

author: hydrack53
title: Son's accident
body:
My 4-year-old had an accident yesterday afternoon where he landed on his ankle/foot. This ended with him walking with his foot turned inwards and limping. I called NHS 24 and the call was answered right away. The call handler was lovely and took all details and passed them onto a clinician.  
The clinician then referred us to a clinical nurse advisor at our local health board, NHS Forth Valley. We received a phone call within around 20 minutes and she had us booked in for an appointment at Stirling Minor Injuries 40 minutes later.  
We were seen right away by an ANP who was so lovely and patient with my son. We then had X-ray done 10 minutes later and straight back to ANP. The service was just outstanding from start to finish. No waiting around for ages and lovely faces. Thank you to our NHS.

author: Motherwell2022
title: A massive thank you
body: From start to finish you nurses in the Day Surgery Unit at University Hospital Wishaw were amazing. I cannot thank yous enough for everything you did for me. I would also like to say a special mention to my surgeon, Miss Thornton, who was amazing 🤩 and explained the whole procedure before and after my operation. Thanks again for looking after me.

author: The plumber
title: Easy and comfortable procedure
body:
I had previously an infected cyst in the neck which required surgery. Since this happened it had grown back and required a further procedure.  
My most recent procedure was booked for 8:30 am in mid-October. I arrived at Larbert royal at 8:10 was shown exactly where to go by the welcoming reception staff. The very polite ambulatory care team, Kirsty and Alisha, took me in before my allotted time slot, discussed the procedure and made me feel at ease and comfortable while keeping me chatting throughout the procedure, which made the time go by very quickly.  
I cannot thank them enough for making me feel so at ease throughout the process.

author: bkg77
title: Professional, kind and caring.
body: Injury to finger, bleeding and painful. Treated by Mikayla in A & E who was professional, kind and caring.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: controllerfq43
title: Doctor's ignorance
body:
My fiance went to A&E with burns to her face, neck and arm. The usual wait. The doctor then saw her and gave her advice. We thanked the doctor for their time.  
As we were walking out through the waiting area, the doctor turned in front of other staff and patients at the top of their voice from 15 feet away and asked us if we had taken any needles, and demanded to see our hands.  
We were mortified, embarrassed and felt so belittled. Unbelievable, my partner has been sober for 8 months and needles are free at any chemist. Completely unnecessary.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: charliegr97
title: Post cancer recovery
body: I felt very weak and tired and sore at the start, but by the end of the 12 week course I was much stronger, less breathless and more confident in my abilities. For example, at the start I would have to sit out some of the exercises or use no/small weights, but as time went on I could use the heavy weights and do all exercises Joe asked me to. I feel a lot more confident going forward.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible experience
body:
The  receptionist is extremely rude and abrasive. He walks away from customers as they address him. I greeted him and he literally walked away as I was talking, returned 5 minutes later and abruptly asked what I wanted. 
He refused to hand my mother a doctor's note addressed in her name. He even opened it before her and threw it at her, demanding that she read it whilst withholding the envelope. He should not be in a front-facing role and he definitely needs behavioural training. He also doesn’t answer the phone so booking an appointment is almost impossible. It is not acceptable to have such an obnoxious and socially inept individual organising a medical centre that involves potentially life-threatening cases.

author: A Nother
title: My recent stay as a Patient...
body:
I required to attend the A & E unit on a very busy Sunday at the start of October. After triage I was admitted to the Assessment Ward for further care and treatment. I just would like to say that from the Consultants, Registrar's, Nursing staff to the Cleaning and Catering staff I was so impressed with the level of care, courtesy and concern that I received during the 3 days I was with you.  
The staff were working in a challenging environment with not all patients showing respect and good manners. Despite this all staff carried on with their duties in the most professional manner and are a credit to themselves and to your Hospital. Heartfelt thank you from a very grateful now recovered recipient of their care.  
Thank you

title: Awful practice
body:
I'm shocked to see that on their website they are 'accepting new patients' as they are unable to deal with the ones they have at present.
You have no chance of seeing your gp in the same day. If you call at 8am you are put on hold for a minimum of 50 minutes and when you finally get to talk to receptionist you are told to fill in an online form or go to emergency care center. Best way, if you can get to speak to anyone, is to book an appointment with them every 2 weeks for the rest of the year just in case you need it or even better join another surgery!!

title: fantastic care
body: Thank-you for the care and service I received in Barnets emergency care. Especially the care I had in AAU. The staff and medical care were first class. It was a traumatic experience I had but it was relieved by the care I received. Thanks again.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: tessab02
title: Everyone was kind and helpful
body:
I had a great experience this morning at the Women's Health Unit, Ward 1b. Everyone was kind and helpful, putting me completely at ease and reassuring me throughout the process.  
Lucy did the ultrasound, and Stephanie completed my examination with SIS Palmer, SM Folg and HC Janet in assistance. Even the parking and paying for parking was easy, not to mention the lovely cuppa and toasted tea cake at the cafe.  
Thank you all.

title: Shocking service
body: It is impossible to make an appointment or see a GP. I have spent hours waiting for my calls to be answered. The service provided is absolutely shocking. I have tried completing the online econsult form and I am never called by the deadline given. Also, when I finally get a call, it is not from a GP at the surgery instead it is outsourced. The GPs that contact do not read the detail on the referral form and are of no real assistance. I was then told I could be seen by a GP, but it would be in Kingsbury or Kilburn. I do not drive and the issue I need to see my GP about affects my mobility. I asked that the matter be referred back to a GP at this surgery where I am a patient. Still have had no contact from any GP at the surgery. I would really advice that this practice be avoided at all costs. It is extremely distressing when you are unwell and have to deal with this disgraceful service. Management at the practice really need to step up and provide an actual service to patients, it is really shameful what is going on in this surgery.

title: Well organised
body: Appointment was for Covid injection- it was extremely well organised with very little waiting time Helpful staff
